main event: A round object was observed over Englewood, Ohio on November 20, 1961, appearing like a full moon in size, and disappeared to the south.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 5 to 10 minutes,The object exhibited erratic movement,It was seen by a civilian observer,The observer speculated that the object could have been the moon distorted by atmospheric conditions,The report indicates a possibility of confusion with celestial objects like Aldebaran.
sighted object: round object like a full-moon in size
witness description: civilian observer who experienced visual observation
